pull_request.title: i#6394: Replace sentinel in trace with real return address.
pull_request.body:
Update drwrap to check if the return address is a sentinel. If it is, look for the real return address at the outer level.

When  -record_replace_retaddr is used in X86 platforms, the return address in the stack is replaced by the sentinel.
For a tailcall, the current implementation uses the address in the stack, the sentinel, as the return address. The change is to check if the return address in the stack is the sentinel or not. If it is, replace it with the return address of the outer level.

The problem can be reproduced by 

./build/bin64/drrun -t drcachesim -offline -record_replace_retaddr -record_function 'tailcall_with_retaddr|1&foo|1' -- ../build_suite/build_debug-internal-64/suite/tests/bin/common.getretaddr

A test is added to cover -record_replace_retaddr with common.getretaddr which has a tailcall.

Fixes: #6394

issue.title: i#5505 kernel tracing: Changes to enable third-party import
issue.body:
Makes various changes to the kernel PT tracing code to allow third-party code to import and integrate the kernel tracing functionality.

Adds structs for pt_data_buf_t and pt_metadata_buf_t that describe one unit of data read from the kthread file. Extracts pt_metadata_t from drpttracer.h to a new header (drpttracer_shared.h) to allow easy sharing with drmemtrace.

Adds drmemtrace APIs to get the kcore, kallsyms and kernel log file paths.

Separates out the logic to read kernel PT data from kthread file into a separate get_next_kernel_entry function which can be overridden by 3P code.

Adds raw2trace stats for count of system calls decoded using PT and the count of kernel instructions in the trace.

Updates the expected output for the tool.drcacheoff.kernel.simple test.

Makes other misc fixes, like using non-relative headers in include statements, and fixes a bug with uninitialised vars and wrong drcontext being used.

Removes pre_read_pt_entries from tdata which is used to buffer the PT data header until we read the PT data. This is
not really needed as we always read the data immediately after reading the header.

Modifies tool.drcacheoff.kernel.simple_SUDO to use "-raw_compress none" which enables check for unsafe static behaviour
(use of malloc etc) for the kernel tracing flow.

Verified locally that the kernel tests, which require root privileges and the PT feature on the processor, pass: client.drpttracer_SUDO-test and tool.drcacheoff.kernel.simple_SUDO.

Issue: #5505

comment.body:
The RISC-V workflow is failing with errors like

E: Unable to locate package libunwind8:riscv64

issue.title: Add IR interface to distinguish memory store data sources from address/index registers
issue.body:
An AArch64 trace simulator is asking for a way to distinguish for a post-index store STR the data source register from the address register which is also a separate source (for the post-index add).

The DR IR does not model data movement semantics: it just has flat lists of sources and dests and does not want to get into SIMD swaps and shuffles.  Taint trackers have to do per-opcode dispatch for complex operations (mostly SIMD; most GPR ops are pretty simple), and generally tools going that deep rely on certain operand orderings.

Is it worth adding some kind of more formal IR interface for distinguishing which register does what for stores?  Probably.

Why didn't any of our own existing tools hit this?
+ I think the memory value tool waits until after the store and loads the value back: so it does not have to deal with identifying the source (maybe partly to handle complexities like widening, e.g. x86 movzx or movsx).
+ Taint tracking tools: should want to propagate data src to memory shadow but post-index src to post-index: so those tools would need to know which is which.  But the Dr. Memory tool is not ported to AArch64; and this is easier on x86?  So it may be no existing tool really needed this feature before.

One way to exclude *-index today for AArch64 is to exclude a non-first source reg which is also a dest: any other source reg is a data source being written.  That's if STP can't be post-indexed.  So it gets complex and a helper is useful.

commits.message:
i#5843 scheduler: Mark more maybe-blocking syscalls (#6380)

Add epoll_pwait2, sendmmsg, recvmmsg, and membarrier to the
maybe-blocking syscall list. These don't always block: e.g., membarrier
has some sub-operations for which it never blocks.

Updates the DR syscall headers to include recently added syscalls,
including epoll_pwait2. The uapi headers are only partly updated due to
lack of easy access to a header to fill in the other SYS_ defines.

Issue: #5843

i#6344 record_syscall: Record return values and add failure marker (#6378)

Changes what the drmemtrace -record_syscall feature does with system
call returns to record the actual value instead of the success boolean.
Adds a new TRACE_MARKER_TYPE_SYSCALL_FAILED to indicate failure.

Adds a sanity test to allasm-repstr (and updates other tests that have
hardcoded counts for this app).

Adds documentation on the change.

Issue: #6344

i#6367: Insert FILTER_ENDPOINT when going to TRACE from COUNT also. (#6368)

For BIMODAL traces (see
https://github.com/DynamoRIO/dynamorio/issues/5199), the normal
transition is from COUNT to L0_FILTER to TRACE. But some threads may
transition from COUNT to TRACE directly e.g., if they were not scheduled
during L0_FILTER mode. In this case, the FILTER_ENDPOINT marker is not
inserted currently, which leads to raw2trace failures.

An example cmd line that reproduces the bug is shown below. Note that
there is only one worker thread which transitions through L0_FILTER and
TRACE mode while the main thread is still in COUNT mode.

```
bin64/drrun -t drcachesim -offline \
-trace_after_instrs 2200K -L0_filter_until_instrs 10K -max_trace_size 10K -- ./threadsig 1 1000
```

Issue: #6367

i#6376: Add issue# for supporting online func tracing (#6377)

Adds #6376 to the comment that documents that we do not currently
support function tracing in the drmemtrace online mode.

Issue: #6376

i#3544 RV64: Implement link_indirect_exit_arch (#6383)

The implementation of this function is roughly the same as AArch64,
except for some additional handling of C extension instructions.

Issue: #3544

Document the endianness of drmemtrace wire formats (#6379)

Adds explicit documentation that the various drmemtrace packed on-disk
formats are little-endian, except the raw offline trace format (for
efficiency). The memref_t format is left as flexible as the reader can
convert from the little-endian trace_entry_t if desired.

i#5036 A64 scatter gather: Avoid dependency on drutil (#6389)

drx has a BSD license so we don't want it to depend on drutil which has
an LGPL license.

The replaces the drutil_insert_get_mem_addr() call with equivalent code
to calculate the start address for the contiguous memory range.

Issue: #5036

i#3044 AArch64 SVE codec: fix scalar+immediate LD/ST offsets (#6390)

All SVE scalar+immediate LD[1234]/ST[1234] have a signed 4-bit immediate
value that encodes a vector index offset from the base register. This
value was being used directly in the IR for instructions, however
base+disp memory operands should always use a byte displacement.

This changes the codec to use byte displacements in the IR and updates
the codec unit tests accordingly.

The following instructions are updated:

LD1B    { <Zt>.B }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD1B    { <Zt>.H }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD1B    { <Zt>.S }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD1B    { <Zt>.D }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD1D    { <Zt>.D }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD1H    { <Zt>.H }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD1H    { <Zt>.S }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD1H    { <Zt>.D }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD1SB   { <Zt>.D }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD1SB   { <Zt>.S }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD1SB   { <Zt>.H }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD1SH   { <Zt>.D }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD1SH   { <Zt>.S }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD1SW   { <Zt>.D }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD1W    { <Zt>.S }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD1W    { <Zt>.D }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD2B    { <Zt1>.B, <Zt2>.B }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD2D    { <Zt1>.D, <Zt2>.D }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD2H    { <Zt1>.H, <Zt2>.H }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD2W    { <Zt1>.S, <Zt2>.S }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD3B    { <Zt1>.B, <Zt2>.B, <Zt3>.B }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD3D    { <Zt1>.D, <Zt2>.D, <Zt3>.D }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD3H    { <Zt1>.H, <Zt2>.H, <Zt3>.H }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD3W    { <Zt1>.S, <Zt2>.S, <Zt3>.S }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD4B    { <Zt1>.B, <Zt2>.B, <Zt3>.B, <Zt4>.B }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD4D    { <Zt1>.D, <Zt2>.D, <Zt3>.D, <Zt4>.D }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD4H    { <Zt1>.H, <Zt2>.H, <Zt3>.H, <Zt4>.H }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LD4W    { <Zt1>.S, <Zt2>.S, <Zt3>.S, <Zt4>.S }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LDNF1B  { <Zt>.B }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LDNF1B  { <Zt>.H }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LDNF1B  { <Zt>.S }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LDNF1B  { <Zt>.D }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LDNF1D  { <Zt>.D }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]
LDNF1H  { <Zt>.H }, <Pg>/Z, [<Xn|SP>{, #<simm>, MUL VL}]

pull_request.title: i#5505 kernel tracing: Changes to enable third-party import
pull_request.body:
Makes various changes to the kernel PT tracing code to allow third-party code to import and integrate the kernel tracing functionality.

Adds structs for pt_data_buf_t and pt_metadata_buf_t that describe one unit of data read from the kthread file. Extracts pt_metadata_t from drpttracer.h to a new header (drpttracer_shared.h) to allow easy sharing with drmemtrace.

Adds drmemtrace APIs to get the kcore, kallsyms and kernel log file paths.

Separates out the logic to read kernel PT data from kthread file into a separate get_next_kernel_entry function which can be overridden by 3P code.

Adds raw2trace stats for count of system calls decoded using PT and the count of kernel instructions in the trace.

Updates the expected output for the tool.drcacheoff.kernel.simple test.

Makes other misc fixes, like using non-relative headers in include statements, and fixes a bug with uninitialised vars and wrong drcontext being used.

Removes pre_read_pt_entries from tdata which is used to buffer the PT data header until we read the PT data. This is
not really needed as we always read the data immediately after reading the header.

Modifies tool.drcacheoff.kernel.simple_SUDO to use "-raw_compress none" which enables check for unsafe static behaviour
(use of malloc etc) for the kernel tracing flow.

Verified locally that the kernel tests, which require root privileges and the PT feature on the processor, pass: client.drpttracer_SUDO-test and tool.drcacheoff.kernel.simple_SUDO.

Issue: #5505

pull_request.title: i#5505 kernel tracing: Changes to enable third-party import
pull_request.body:
Makes various changes to the kernel PT tracing code to allow third-party code to import and integrate the kernel tracing functionality.

Adds structs for pt_data_buf_t and pt_metadata_buf_t that describe one unit of data read from the kthread file. Extracts pt_metadata_t from drpttracer.h to a new header (drpttracer_shared.h) to allow easy sharing with drmemtrace.

Adds drmemtrace APIs to get the kcore, kallsyms and kernel log file paths.

Separates out the logic to read kernel PT data from kthread file into a separate get_next_kernel_entry function which can be overridden by 3P code.

Adds raw2trace stats for count of system calls decoded using PT and the count of kernel instructions in the trace.

Updates the expected output for the tool.drcacheoff.kernel.simple test.

Makes other misc fixes, like using non-relative headers in include statements, and fixes a bug with uninitialised vars and wrong drcontext being used.

Removes pre_read_pt_entries from tdata which is used to buffer the PT data header until we read the PT data. This is
not really needed as we always read the data immediately after reading the header.

Modifies tool.drcacheoff.kernel.simple_SUDO to use "-raw_compress none" which enables check for unsafe static behaviour
(use of malloc etc) for the kernel tracing flow.

Verified locally that the kernel tests, which require root privileges and the PT feature on the processor, pass: client.drpttracer_SUDO-test and tool.drcacheoff.kernel.simple_SUDO.

Issue: #5505

pull_request.title: i#5505 kernel tracing: Changes to enable third-party import
pull_request.body:
Makes various changes to the kernel PT tracing code to allow third-party code to import and integrate the kernel tracing functionality.

Adds structs for pt_data_buf_t and pt_metadata_buf_t that describe one unit of data read from the kthread file. Extracts pt_metadata_t from drpttracer.h to a new header (drpttracer_shared.h) to allow easy sharing with drmemtrace.

Adds drmemtrace APIs to get the kcore, kallsyms and kernel log file paths.

Separates out the logic to read kernel PT data from kthread file into a separate get_next_kernel_entry function which can be overridden by 3P code.

Adds raw2trace stats for count of system calls decoded using PT and the count of kernel instructions in the trace.

Updates the expected output for the tool.drcacheoff.kernel.simple test.

Makes other misc fixes, like using non-relative headers in include statements, and fixes a bug with uninitialised vars and wrong drcontext being used.

Removes pre_read_pt_entries from tdata which is used to buffer the PT data header until we read the PT data. This is
not really needed as we always read the data immediately after reading the header.

Modifies tool.drcacheoff.kernel.simple_SUDO to use "-raw_compress none" which enables check for unsafe static behaviour
(use of malloc etc) for the kernel tracing flow.

Verified locally that the kernel tests, which require root privileges and the PT feature on the processor, pass: client.drpttracer_SUDO-test and tool.drcacheoff.kernel.simple_SUDO.

Issue: #5505

not really needed as we always read the data immediately after reading the header.

(use of malloc etc) for the kernel tracing flow.

Verified locally that the kernel tests, which require root privileges and the PT feature on the processor, pass: client.drpttracer_SUDO-test and tool.drcacheoff.kernel.simple_SUDO.

Issue: #5505

comment.body: wrap_level starts out -1.  ASSERT that it is >= 0.

pull_request.title: i#6394: Replace sentinel in trace with real return address.
pull_request.body:
Update drwrap to check if the return address is a sentinel. If it is, look for the real return address at the outer level.

When  -record_replace_retaddr is used in X86 platforms, the return address in the stack is replaced by the sentinel.
For a tailcall, the current implementation uses the address in the stack, the sentinel, as the return address. The change is to check if the return address in the stack is the sentinel or not. If it is, replace it with the return address of the outer level.

The problem can be reproduced by 

./build/bin64/drrun -t drcachesim -offline -record_replace_retaddr -record_function 'tailcall_with_retaddr|1&foo|1' -- ../build_suite/build_debug-internal-64/suite/tests/bin/common.getretaddr

A test is added to cover -record_replace_retaddr with common.getretaddr which has a tailcall.

Fixes: #6394

comment.body: Wait: I thought if we replaced in the tailcall entry, we did not need this?  This can be removed, right?  Replaced by an assert that the value is not the sentinel?

comment.body: Sub-structs are not auto-packed by an outer-packed struct: but I see this type is marked packed.  Add a comment that it's already marked packed.
